Class GenerateLog

  • java.lang.Object
    • GenerateLog

  • public class GenerateLog
extends java.lang.Object

    Generate Log

    The Generate Log program implements an application that Generates the Log file for 1 day from 2014-10-31 00:00 till 2014-10-31 23:59

    All the functions are private functions except the constructor, main and generateLog To include the information about the generateLog method in javadoc it is made public

    Since:
    2016-04-25
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Akshat Misra

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GenerateLog(java.lang.String path)
      Constructor takes the argument and creates the directory if not already created.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GenerateLog

        public GenerateLog(java.lang.String path)
        Constructor takes the argument and creates the directory if not already created. In case of an IOException, terminates the program
        Parameters:
        path - Directory location provided as a command line parameter while running the program
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the directory cannot be created
        See Also:
        IOException

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Creates the GenerateLog class object
        Parameters:
        args - 1 argument required directory location. if more arguments are passed, program will exit with "Arguments not valid" message. if no argument is passed, program will exit with "Please provide the Directory path" message.

      • generateLog

        public void generateLog(java.lang.String time,
               java.lang.String ip,
               int cpuId,
               int usage)
        Enters the log entries to the log file log.txt
        Parameters:
        time - Timestamp of the log
        ip - Server IP address
        cpuId - CPU Id
        usage - CPU usage
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException
        java.io.IOException
        See Also:
        FileNotFoundException, IOException
